node.title: Review prompts police to halt plans to use facial recognition technology
node.description: Police are pausing further development of live facial recognition technology amid privacy and human rights concerns.
node.content:
["Police are pausing further development of live facial recognition technology amid privacy and human rights concerns.", "", "
\nPhoto: 123RF\n
", "The decision follows an independent review, which has made 10 recommendations, including wider public consultation on ethical issues relating to live monitoring, and reviewing current collection of facial images by police.", "Deputy chief executive of police Mark Evans said the review gave clear guidance on the legal and ethical use of the technology.", "He said, while facial recognition technology was controversial, it also offered opportunities for more effective policing.", "A response plan based on the recommendations has been launched to ensure the safety and security of police staff and communities is a priority in police thinking, he said.", "\"FRT is a subject that draws strong interest, and sometimes distrust and controversy along with it. However, with this technology's fast paced development, there are also opportunities for more effective policing.", "\"Getting this balance right is imperative, and the review has given us clear guidance on the legal and ethical use of this technology,' he said."]
